reference.shortdesc: The cbreset_password tool is used to reset an administrative or read-only user password.

section.title: Syntax
section.p: The basic syntax to reset the administrative password:
This results in output as follows:
section.codeblock: Please enter the new administrative password (or <Enter> for system generated password):
section.p: Enter a password of six characters or more or accept the system generated password. After entering a password or accepting a generated one, the system prompts for confirmation:
section.codeblock: Running this command will reset administrative password. Do you really want to do it? (yes/no)yes

section.title: Description
section.p: This tool is found in the following locations, depending upon your platform:

section.title: Example
section.p: Reset the password and shows a successful response.
section.codeblock:
# cbreset_password 10.5.2.117:8091
Please enter the new administrative password (or <Enter> for system generated password):
Running this command will reset administrative password. Do you really want to do it? (yes/no)yes Resetting administrative password... Password for user Administrator was successfully replaced.
section.p: The following example response shows a system generated password.
section.codeblock: Resetting administrative password... Password for user Administrator was successfully replaced. New password is Uxye76FJ
section.p: There are a few possible errors from this command:
section.codeblock:
{error,<<"The password must be at least six characters.">>}
{error,<<"Failed to reset administrative password. Node is not initialized.">>}
section.p: The first error message indicates that the password wasn't long enough. The second error message indicates that Couchbase Server is not yet configured and running.
